The scenario presented in the diagram is impossible. IQs are calculated by standard deviation from the mean: 100. So by definition the average IQ is 100 and will always be 100 for eternity. Now, it is true a year 1950 100 IQ would certainly be different then a year 2110 100 IQ, but thats a separate question. I don’t think it is true that humans are becoming less intelligent with technology. It all depends on what is considered intelligence. In older times it was important to keep many things in someones head because it is not feasible to constantly be referring back to books for everything you ever needed to know. In current times, the average person may keep fewer hard skills in their head but I think this allows humans to clear bandwidth in their brains to focus on other problems. In this sense, our problem solving skills are far more advanced then they used to be. This is speculative of course, it would be difficult to compare since every generation had different “truths” at the time that restricted thinking. It would be unfair to call someone living in year 1200 unintelligent because they thought the world was flat. Just like now I am sure there are many parts of life that will seem ridiculous in the future!

Your picture is invalid. First of all, IQ tests are meant to baseline at 100 - 100 is the mid point where everyone “should” be (below it you’re less intelligent then average, above it - more intelligent). If people are found to be over-performing an IQ test (ex: The median is now 120 instead of 100) - then the IQ test is made “harder” so that the previously very smart 120 IQ people are now 100 IQ people. Flynn effect - Wikipedia The question also goes against current understanding, which is that IQ scores were improving until at the very least the 1990s. Whether this is because computers are making IQ tests frivolous or because of poor education, is unknown, but the chart that shows a drop of 10 points when the IQ scores have been getting more difficult is obviously wrong. Smarter than ever? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intelligence_quotient Different IQ tests

Actually, there is a fair amount of evidence to suggest IQ scores are dropping gradually around the world, but particularly in the Western nations. There are a number of controversial theories to explain it; for instance, some have suggested it’s because more intelligent people are having less children, or even increased migrant populations are diluting the intelligence level. However, the most plausible theory I have read suggests it’s down to the overall age of the population increasing: We seem to be getting stupider and population ageing may be why

Not only is that chart from a garbage source. Not only are you confusing IQ scores with wisdom, of all things. Not only is that chart obviously not correct, in the sense that an IQ of 100 is DEFINED as average. That chart is wrong in that it shows the exact opposite of reality: IQ tests have to be periodically adjusted to prevent people from scoring too high because of the Flynn effect. IQs, in average, raise almost 3 points per decade. So, an average person in 2010 would score over 115 in a 1950 test.

I don’t have any idea where that chart you posted came from, but the concept is ridiculous, and the magnitude of any change in intelligence up or down presumably immeasurably small, unless you count additional technological knowledge as intelligence, in which case our current and recent generations have been getting remarkably brighter year by year. You can rest assured that no scientifically neutral means of intelligence measurement supports what somebody wrote on that chart. I suspect it is a total fraud, and perhaps based on some argument being made by somebody with something to sell us.
